Posts.Content: Had surgery 1 year go with 33 radiation treatments. Have ferritin iron issues (too high along with calcium).  Hair has become thin on top - noticebly so.  Was put on Arimidex until last week.  I walked with a cane all winter.  Extreme joint pain and stiffness with bone scans showing agressive arthritis.  Very little problems prior to Arimidex.  Just been changed to Aromasin.  I hope this is better.  My 81 year old mother got around better than me(54).  I hope someone can help.   Thanks
Posts.Title: hair loss problems

Posts.Content: Yes, these drugs are all in the same family.  They all can cause hair loss.  My wig looks nice.
Posts.Title: Hair Thinning Problems

Posts.Content: On 7/31/2009 CindyD wrote: This is my second reply to your message.  I was switched from Femara to Aromasin in June.  When I first read your message, my hair was fine.  But during the last few weeks I have noticed a lot of hair loss and thinning just like you are experiencing.  My bathroom counters are covered in hair each time I brush or blow dry it.  It reminds me of when I was first diagnosed and was on chemo (Gemstar).  I didn't lose all my hair but it thinned out extremely.   I haven't been happy with the side effects of Aromasin.  My next doctor appointment is on August 10th.  I am going to discuss different options with him at that time. Let me know if you decide to change medication and you find one that you adjust to better.   Cindy    Thanky Cindy, My next appointment is this coming Monday. I'm going to discuss it with him.  I have also noticed a lot of hip pain.  If he changes my drug I'll let you know. Some days are more tolerable than others.  I'll keep you posted.
Posts.Title: Hair Thinning Problems

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed last year with breast cancer and underwent radiation. I was then placed on Arimidex. I encountered numerous problems with stiffness of joints, agressive arthritis, and tons of muscular pain. Recently(thru a change of doctors) I was placed on Aromasin.  I am beginning to have more joint stiffness but am still trying this med.  There is a very noticable difference in my hair.  It is really thinning out.  Anyone with any suggestions?  Or has this impacted any one else???  I sure don't want to feel like LoneRanger.
Posts.Title: Hair Thinning Problems

Posts.Content: Don't know for sure if it will come back, but I bought a wig this weekend and feel better about myself.   Thanks for the reply
